phrases.usage: Use this to start your story about the weekend.
phrases.example: Last Saturday, I visited my very friendly cousin for lunch.

phrases.usage: Say this to talk about things you did on Sunday.
phrases.example: Yesterday, I stayed at home and read a busy book.

phrases.usage: Use this to tell someone about a specific place.
phrases.example: I went to the large park with my happy dog.

phrases.usage: Use this to describe a relaxing activity you did.
phrases.example: I watched a movie at night with my best friend.

phrases.usage: Tell others about your social plans with another person.
phrases.example: I met a friend for lunch at a quiet cafe.

phrases.usage: Explain how you felt about your activity or event.
phrases.example: It was fun because the weather was sunny and warm.

phrases.usage: Use this to tell someone the time you stopped.
phrases.example: I finished at ten and felt very tired and sleepy.

phrases.usage: Use this to talk about the next thing you did.
phrases.example: Then I went home and ate a tasty, healthy dinner.

keyVocabulary.definition: Having a lot of things to do.
Not making much noise or having many people.
Being kind and pleasant to other people.
Needing to rest or go to sleep soon.
Making you feel very happy and interested.
